Captain: Avast, Chief! Ye ship were caught in a fierce storm,
and we had ta’ beach her to avoid sinkin'.
The rudder be damaged and won't turn proper.
We need to fix it afore we can set sail again.
Parrot: Blimey, Chief! The main mast be in terrible shape.
It were hit by lightning during the storm,
and now it be leanin' to one side, pieces everywhere!
We'll have to repair it afore we can raise the sails.
Quartermaster: Avast, Chief! We've emptied the ship
to see what damage the storm hath wrought.
It be a mess down below, and we'll need to sift
through everything to see what we can salvage.
Chef: Shiver me timbers, Chief! The storm were so rough,
we had to jettison some cargo to lighten the ship's load.
We were able to save most of the valuable stuff,
but we lost a few barrels of rum in the process.
Gunner: Ahoy, Chief! We've unloaded the ship to assess the damage.
It be a good thing we did, 'cause the rudder be not a working.
We need to patch it up afore we can sail a’gin.
Pirate1: Arr, Chief, it be lookin' like the foremast snapped
and the rigging and ropes had some weak points that gave way.
We'll need to repair it before we can set a sail again.
Pirate2: Arr, Chief! The foremast took a beatin' during the storm.
It be cracked in several places,
and we'll need to replace some of the damaged parts.
We'll need your expertise to get it back in shape.
Veteran: We've been workin' on finding the rudder parts
We'll keep ye posted of any further pieces we ‘a find.
